title: Arewa Data Science Fellowship
text:
Arewa Data Science Fellowship
Welcome to Arewa Data Science Academy! We are a community of educators, learners and data science enthusiasts with a passion for empowering marginalized students to reach their full potential.
Our mission is to provide students with the skills and knowledge they need to succeed in the rapidly evolving field of data science. We believe that everyone should have access to the tools and resources they need to pursue their dreams, regardless of their background or circumstances.
To achieve this mission, we offer a wide range of programs and services to students from all over Nigeria. Our student mentoring programs provide personalized support and guidance to help students succeed in their studies. We also offer seminars and workshops on data science, machine learning and related fields to university students, to help them stay current with the latest advancements in the field.
One of the core focus of our academy is free training to affected marginalized students, we hold weekend training sessions and this year we are thrilled to announce that these training will be more structured and streamlined than ever before, thanks to the sponsorship of Google Research, TensorFlow and HausaNLP and Bayero University Kano. We are particularly focusing on underrepresented groups such as Women and Students from Arewa and communities affected by insecurity as part of our efforts to bridge the gap and bring equal opportunities to all.
We invite you to join our community and be a part of our mission to empower marginalized students and build a more equitable future. Thank you for considering Arewa Data Science Academy!

title: ArewaDS FellowShip
text:
Get in Touch
Thank you for visiting the Arewa Data Science Academy website. We are dedicated to providing accessible and quality data science education to marginalized students and we value your feedback and input.
Our team is here to assist you with any questions or inquiries you may have. Whether you are interested in learning more about our programs, exploring potential collaboration opportunities, or just want to know more about what we do, please do not hesitate to reach out.
For general inquiries, you can contact us via email at arewadatascience@gmail.com. We will make every effort to respond to your inquiry in a timely manner, typically within 24 hours during business days.
We also have a Telegram channel for students and learners where you can connect with us, collaborate, ask questions and connect with like-minded people, you can join by visiting this link
Here at Arewa Data Science Academy, we believe that data science education should be accessible to all and we strive to empower marginalized students to achieve their full potential through our programs. We are excited to hear from you and to work together towards a more equitable future in data science.
Thank you for your interest in Arewa Data Science Academy. We value your feedback and would love to hear from you. If you are interested to be a mentor, please, reach out.
Email: arewadatascience[at]gmail.com.
Telegram Channel: click to join.

title: Idris Abdulmumin
text:
Biography
Idris Abdulmumin is a faculty member of Ahmadu Bello University Zaria. His research focuses on low resource natural language processing (NLP), with special interest in machine translation. He received his Bachelor and Master of Science degrees from Bayero University, Kano, and Nottingham Trent University, United Kingdom respectively. Idris has just completed his PhD at Bayero University, Kano, and will resume with the University of Pretoria Data Science for Social Impact Research Group as a Postdoctoral researcher to work on NLP for low resource African languages.

title: Abubakar Bala
text:
Biography
Just finished a PhD on using AI to detect faults in the engines of aircrafts.
Now I am focused on building end-end machine learning applications (MLOps)
I also do public speaking and write thought-provoking stories.

title: Bashir Mohammed
text:
Biography
Bashir is an experienced AI/ML researcher and a staff Computational Research Engineer at Berkeley Lab. He is part of Berkeley Lab‚Äôs Cybersecurity R&D for Science and Energy in the Integrated Data Frameworks(IDF) group under the Scientific Data Division.
His research revolves around AI/ML for networking, systems control, data provenance, and scientific data management in HPC and distributed systems.
In the past, he was a postdoc on the Deep Learning and Artificial Intelligence High-Performance Networks(DAPHNE) project at Berkeley Lab. His work focused on developing AI and Machine Learning algorithms to optimally control distributed network resources, improve high-speed big data transfers and control high-speed networks that will minimize network downtime and avoid network traffic congestion for critical exascale scientific workflows.
He is a Berkeley Lab research SLAM 2019 award winner. In 2019 he was among six postdoctoral fellows from US National Labs invited to Washington DC, to speak to the Capitol Hill audience about their research. He is a passionate science communicator.

title: Fauziya Ado Yakasai
text:
Biography
Dr.Yakasai is an experienced researcher and data science professional with over 7 years of combined experience in data science, statistics, mathematics, and research in academia and corporate America. Expert in applied mathematics, statistics, business analytics, and data science with a rich blend of teaching and quantitative research experience.
Hardworking mathematicians, statisticians, and business/data analysts with expertise in statistical and data modeling, probability, and numerical integration. Proficient in data mining techniques, including data entry, compilation, sampling, cleaning, transformation, QA/QC, data visualization, etc. Strong passion and commitment in artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and deep learning (DL)
Fauziya holds a Bachelor of Science (BS) in Mathematics from Bayero University, Kano, Nigeria; a Master of Science (MS) in Pure and Applied Mathematics from the African University of Science and Technology, Abuja, Nigeria; a Master of Science (MS) in Probability and Statistics from Auburn University, Auburn, Alabama; and a PhD in Mathematics from Auburn University, Auburn, Alabama. She has a Graduate Certification in Business Analytics from Auburn University in Auburn, Alabama. She is currently a postdoctoral fellow in Data Analysis of R&D partnerships at York University, Canada, and a Data Science consultant at LOCOMeX inc USA.

title: Ibrahim S. Ahmad
text:
Biography
I am currently a lecturer with the Department of Information Technology, Bayero University Kano. I completed my Ph.D at Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Malaysia in 2020.
My research interests lie in the areas of Data Science which includes areas of Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning.
I am a co-founder of the HausaNLP (www.hausanlp.org) research group, where we focus on research related to NLP in African (low resource) languages. We are beneficiaries of over 10 research grants across diverse areas of NLP in low resource languages.
As a lecturer with Bayero University Kano, my responsibilities include teaching and supervising both undergraduate and postgraduate students. Currently, I teach CSC8303 Artificial Intelligence for MSc Computer Science program and ICT8302 Enterprise Database Management for Master of Information and Communication Technology.

title: Musa Muhammed Kabila
text:
Biography
Kabila is an enthusiastic data analyst experienced with Machine learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data Mining, and Natural Language Processing (NLP).
He received his Bachelor of Science degrees from Bayero University, Kano, Master of Engineering from Central South University, China and Master of Education from University of the People, USA.
Kabila‚Äôs research interests lie in the areas of Data Science with keen interest in areas of Natural Language Processing, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Artificial Intelligence.

title: Mustapha Abdullahi
text:
Biography
Mustapha is a Master‚Äôs in Artificial Intelligence student at the Queen Mary University of London. He is a recipient of the Google DeepMind Scholarship and the joint QuantumBlack (a McKinsey Company) and Office of AI scholarship. He is a student intern at the Large Scale and Data Systems (LSDS), Imperial College London.
Before his Master‚Äôs, Mustapha obtained a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Engineering from Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria. His interests span Machine Learning, Reinforcement Learning, and Robotics.

title: Shamsuddeen H. Muhammad
text:
Biography
Shamsuddeen is a Founder of Arewa Data Science Academy (ADSA) and Co-founder of HausaNLP. He is a faculty member at the Faculty of Computer Science at Bayero University in Kano, Nigeria.
Currently, shamsuddeen is a PhD candidate at the University of Porto in Portugal. His research interests focus on Natural Language Processing for Low-resource languages, Sentiment Analysis, and Deep Learning. He received his Master‚Äôs degree from the University of Manchester in the UK and a Bachelor‚Äôs degree from Bayero University in Kano, Nigeria.

title: Arewa Data Science Team Wins Competition
text:
ArewaDS-LMBF, a team from the Arewa Data Science Fellowship, achieved an impressive feat on May 13th, 2023, by securing second place in the Cohere AI hackathon. Organized by Cohere and AI Saturdays Lagos, the hackathon centered around the theme ‚ÄúEmpower your creativity with Cohere‚Äôs Multilingual Embeddings‚Äù and was hosted on devpost. The event spanned from May 1st to May 7th, 2023, with participants gathering at multiple locations across the continent, including the enthusiastic Arewa Data Science Academy community.
The teams representing ArewaDS showcased their expertise in machine learning, particularly in large language models, as they presented their innovative projects utilizing the Cohere multilingual embeddings API. Among the submissions, ArewaDS-LMBF proposed an exceptional solution that utilised the multilingual embeddings API to align Hausa sentences with their potential translations in English. This approach aimed to contribute to the creation of accurate parallel datasets for machine translation. Their outstanding submission propelled them to the finals, securing them a well-deserved second place in the overall rankings.
Lukman, the team lead of ArewaDS-LMBF, expressed his overwhelming delight at this historic achievement. He remarked, ‚ÄúStarting from scratch in machine learning and winning an AI hackathon within a few months of joining the fellowship is truly incredible. The unwavering support of the mentors in Arewa Data Science Academy played a pivotal role in this accomplishment. They ensured equal opportunities for all fellows and guided us to the right resources. I am immensely grateful for this invaluable experience.‚Äù
As a reward for their outstanding performance, the team was granted a prize of 800 US Dollars, along with 2000 Cohere API credits, to be shared among the five team members. Looking ahead, the team revealed their plans to further enhance their solution while harnessing the cohere platform to deepen their understanding of Natural Language Processing and Large Language Models. Their commitment to continuous improvement and exploration exemplifies their dedication to excellence.
This accomplishment offers a mere glimpse into the transformative impact that the Arewa Data Science Fellowship has had on the lives of its young fellows within a short span of time. The Arewa Data Science Fellowship stands as an intensive program designed to nurture the next generation of research-oriented data scientists. Through its mentorship, monthly stipends, and provision of data, the fellowship equips aspiring data scientists with the necessary tools to thrive in their field. For more information about the fellowship, please visit our website.

title: Arewa Data Science Successful Applicants
text:
Fellowship Successful Applicants
We are thrilled to announce the selection of the first cohort of exceptional applicants for the Arewa Data Science Fellowship program. These individuals have shown exceptional aptitude and passion for data science, and we are confident that they will make significant contributions to the program and to the field of data science as a whole.
The selection process was highly competitive, and we received a large number of excellent applications. We would like to extend our congratulations to all of the successful applicants and we look forward to working with them in the upcoming program.
We are excited to see the impact that this program will have on the data science community and on the career development of these individuals. This fellowship program is a great step towards creating a more inclusive data science community in Nigeria.
The full list of the successful applicants is available here.
In addition to the exceptional training and mentorship they will receive through the Arewa Data Science Fellowship program, successful applicants will also receive a generous monthly stipend and free internet data to ensure they have access to the resources they need to be successful in the program.
Thank you to everyone who applied and we hope to see you again in the next cohort.

title: Arewa Data Science Fellowship
text:
ArewaDS Application is Open :::
The Arewa Data Science Fellowship application is open. The Arewa Data Science fellowship (ADSF) provides an opportunity to learn from data scientists and machine learning experts. The fellowship is a 16-week-long free training that provides a hands-on approach to data science, machine learning and deep learning.
The skills and knowledge acquired during the fellowship will help participants pursue careers in data science, machine learning and research. Our goal is to inspire the next generation of researchers in the North and provide them with the tools they need to be successful. The ADSF fellowship provides support with a monthly stipend during the program.
Applications will be judged based on the strength of the motivation of the applicant, academic record, and scholarly potential.
Application is now closed !

title: Projects
text:
Learn by doing. Theory is nice, but nothing replaces actual experience. -Tony Hsieh

That‚Äôs why our mentors from leading Universities across Nigeria and beyond will guide fellows to undertake challenging and rewarding projects on data science and machine learning tailored to their experience and background.
